posts.content:
Wellness Wednesday 
Doctors don’t make you healthy
Teachers don’t make you learn 
Trainers don’t make you fit
Coaches don’t make you rich
At some point you have to understand that this life, your life is 100% your responsibility

posts.name:
Parth Sanghvi
Parth Sanghvi
posts.content:
You can pick a new path, pivot, or even pause - whenever you feel ready. 

There’s no shame in starting late, starting small, or even starting again.

The only thing that matters is this: are you doing it for you?

Take a moment, think it through, and then take that first step.

No explanations needed.
Just move forward.

comments.commentText:
It answers a lot of questions and make your path clear, ARE YOU DOING IT FOR YOU? 

Also keep asking it, to check if you’re moving in the direction you need to :)
Srushti Warhade self-introspection is very underrated in my opinion!

Rightly said Parth
Courage is required, skills can be learnt but it’s the courage that’s being lacked

posts.name:
Daniel Lordson
Daniel Lordson
posts.content:
Ever wish more people showed up for your sales calls? Here’s a game-changer! 

**Problem:** Many times, folks forget about calls. Email reminders help, but they're easy to miss. This means you might have lots of no-shows. 

**Solution:** Enter our secret weapon: Voice AI! ️ Instead of just relying on emails, we send a friendly voice reminder 60-90 minutes before the call.

Here’s how it works:
1. The Voice AI calls your lead.
2. It reminds them about the upcoming meeting.
3. If they can’t make it, the AI helps them reschedule right then and there. No waiting. No hassle.

**Benefits:**
- Higher show rates for your calls.
- Less time wasted on no-shows.
- Happier leads because they feel taken care of.

Curious about boosting your outreach? Want to see Voice AI in action? Book a free demo, and let’s supercharge your sales!

posts.name:
John Roman
John Roman
posts.content:
STRANGE SALES PROSPECTING ALERT 

I just got hit with a prospecting approach I've never seen before. No email. No introduction. Just a straight-up calendar invite dropped into my inbox for a webinar about "Tackling the Supply Chain Talent Shortage."

Here's the kicker:
 I’ve never spoken to this company.
 I definitely didn’t opt in to anything.
 The explanation for why I should care is all inside the invite.

My initial thoughts:
🟢 It’s bold. Credit where credit is due. Nobody just drops calendar invites out of the blue like this. It’s outside the box, and it definitely got my attention.
🟡 But is it effective? This isn’t a pain point for me, so I won’t be joining the call. But if it was a relevant topic, would I feel differently? Would this approach work better than a traditional email?
 There’s something about skipping the usual prospecting dance (cold email > follow-up > nudge) that feels refreshing... but also a little intrusive.

So now I’m torn. Should this be roasted for being a hard miss, or celebrated for creativity?

My questions to all of you:
 Has anyone else tried this tactic?
 Did it work?
 How would you feel if you got an invite like this?

comments.commentText:
I LITERALLY just posted a TikTok about the return of calendar darts. It’s a real WTF. 

I put it in the category of deceptive sales practices and would immediately block and domain and report as SPAM.

Leslie Venetz Well, you helped me make my decision on these!
It's interesting, there is a new startup that automates brands sending out calendar invites to consumer for sales/promotions. I run my life out of my calendar so it's def intrusive.

posts.name:
steven kamensky
steven kamensky
posts.content:
Happy Wednesday! 
As we embrace the middle of the week, let's remember the importance of spending our energy in the present moment. Every day is a precious gift, and living in the "now" is the key to true happiness and fulfillment. 
Focus on what you can do today to make the most of your time and create beautiful memories. Let go of past regrets and future anxieties, and pour your energy into the present. It's the little moments that make life extraordinary. 
Wishing you an awesome day ahead! Let's live each day to the fullest and cherish every moment. 
I hope this brings a smile to your face and inspires those around you!

posts.name:
Miodrag O. Markovic
Miodrag O. Markovic
posts.content:
When it comes to innovation and ideas, I believe it all circles back to two key elements: curiosity and problem-solving.

For me, it always starts with identifying what’s missing in today’s world.

Pinpointing gaps and imagining how these areas could be upgraded to benefit a broad audience.

I thought about what could become game-changing for people in their lives, businesses, or industries.

In my case, I chose to explore what was lacking in the travel industry.

I identified the pain points travelers face, with cost being a significant challenge.

The solution I envisioned was rooted in the potential of what I believe is the next big thing: Web3.

My team and I created something that addresses the primary issue, reducing travel costs, but also added additional layers of innovation to redefine the experience.

This is my story.

While it may sound easy, the reality is that it has taken years of effort and learning, and we’re still on this journey.

We continue to bridging Web3 and travel, and we know this process takes time.

That’s okay because I believe meaningful innovation must also be sustainable innovation.

I never aimed for quick wins.

And so, I circle back to my original point: stay curious.
Explore, read, think, and always be willing to ask the questions that could lead to transformative ideas.

comments.commentText: Very well said Miodrag and thes two elements are the fabric of innovation
